questions.question_text: Your organization collects information from the public by using a paper form. You want to ensure that employees at your organization can't share images of these forms through email attachments because they contain sensitive information. You have set up a content compliance rule and need to configure the correct settings. What should you do?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
By activating OCR, the compliance rule set will work properly in order to reject the sensitive information captured in the image sent.

Selected Answer: B
I think it's B.https://support.google.com/a/answer/6358855

choices.D: Set up the rule to reject all incoming and outgoing emails with images as attachments.
choices.B: Ensure Optical Character Recognition (OCR) for email attachments is enabled.
choices.A: Set up a Metadata Match expression.
choices.C: Set up the rule to prevent all external outgoing emails with attachments of type that match Adobe PDF.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
In order to maintain the former employee's data, their license should switch to Archive User. Their account should be disable so as to prevent further leaks. The next step is the creation of a matter in Google Vault for further investigation of the leaked data.

Selected Answer: C
I think it's C.https://support.google.com/a/answer/9048836

questions.question_text: An employee left your organization for a competitor and was leaking confidential information externally. You must ensure that the former employee no longer has access to their Workspace account. The manager and the rest of their team still needs access to the documents that they created. You want to keep license costs to a minimum and preserve a legal hold on the Workspace account of the former employee. What should you do?

choices.B: Delete the Workspace account of the former employee.
choices.D: Reset the password of the former employee to something complex, and keep the Workspace account license active.
choices.C: Disable the Workspace account of the former employee, and switch their license to the Archived user type.
choices.A: Rename the Workspace account of the former employee.

questions.question_text: A user named Alice is leaving your organization. You need to transfer all of Alice's data from her Drive to Bob's Drive in the most simple and efficient manner possible. What should you do?

choices.A: Use the Google Admin console to move the files from Alice's Drive to Bob's Drive.
choices.B: Instruct Alice to download all of her files from her Drive and upload them to Bob's Drive.
choices.C: Use the Google Takeout service to export Alice's data to a zip file, and instruct Bob to import the zip file into his Drive.
choices.D: Use the Google Drive API to programmatically transfer the files from Alice's Drive to Bob's Drive.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
I think it's A. https://support.google.com/a/answer/11524030?hl=en#zippy=%2Cdrive

Selected Answer: A
In such scenario, the first step in troubleshooting is the collection of more information regarding the user's device, settings or possible error messages.

Selected Answer: A
I think it's A.

questions.question_text: An employee at your organization is unable to send and receive emails by using their mobile device. You must identify the next step to troubleshoot and fix the issue as quickly as possible. What should you do?

choices.D: Contact Google Workspace support for immediate assistance.
choices.B: Instruct the employee to generate an HTTP Archive (HAR) file recording to start troubleshooting.
choices.C: Tell the employee to reinstall the Gmail application on their phone.
choices.A: Collect more information about the employee’s device, mail client, and error message.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Every legal search regarding an employee needs to start with a new Matter creation in Google Vault. Given the retention policy is indefinite, all the employees' data is intact.

questions.question_text: Your organization’s legal team is conducting a legal review of an employee. The default retention period for your organization is indefinite. You must assist your legal team with retrieving the employee's emails for a one month period. What should you do?

choices.D: Create a new retention rule inside Google Vault. Specify Gmail and the timeframe to retain messages.
choices.C: Specify the time frame and user by using Google Vault’s audit reports. Export the report as a CSV file.
choices.A: Create a new Matter inside Google Vault. Specify Gmail, the user, and the timeframe to retrieve messages.
choices.B: Restore the user’s deleted Gmail messages from the Admin console and export the user’s inbox messages by using an API.
